intro: Bulbine huilensis, commonly known as the Huilé Bulbine, is a flowering plant native to South America, specifically Ecuador. It belongs to the Xanthorrhoeaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that store water, adapting it to arid environments. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or mountainous regions. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
